bdy.p:
The Irving K. Barber Learning Centre (IKBLC) is a facility at the Vancouver campus of the
University of British Columbia . The Learning Centre is built around the refurbished core of the 1925 UBC Main Library1. The Centre is named for Irving. K. Barber, philanthropist and a graduate of UBC.

sec.p: The IKBLC provides library systems, education centre, library and a conduit of knowledge for lifelong learners and space for UBC Library's print collection and collections of rare and special materials 2.

ss1.p: Started in 2006, the goal of the digitization program is to promote access to British Columbia's historical resources, with free online access to provincial historical materials.
Webcasts of lectures are archived and accessible through the Multimedia Repository and video sharing.

sec.p: The Chapman Learning Commons, in a refurbished central section of the Learning Centre, provides space for group work as well as seating for individual study. It provides support and services for research and information literacy instruction, writing assistance, learning skills programs and technology through one-to-one help, workshops, peer mentoring and virtual resources and services.
